conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric render: walls are extruded with visible thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, interior volumes read as spaces, and the ceiling/roof is removed to reveal rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall height/thickness and clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some edges/openings but overall proper corner geometry and readable interior volumes.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches the 2D plan (2 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen zone, two baths, decks). Some proportional differences and a few partition/opening placements appear simplified relative to the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofas, dining table), kitchen blocks present, bathroom fixtures present. Placement generally aligns with expected rooms; a few elements are generalized.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear differentiation of walls/floors and good visibility. Materials are consistent and rendering is clean; some window/door detailing is minimal which slightly reduces structural readability.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows/openings are simplified; not all openings can be confidently matched wall-by-wall to the 2D plan.
Minor layout/proportion deviations and simplified partition geometry compared to the 2D drawing (some room edge lengths/angles appear adjusted).

summary: A valid and clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with only minor-to-moderate simplifications in proportions and door/window placement/detail.
